prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensors
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights that drop into the well were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: First of all, I would like you to explain my motive.
Person: Kanis
Testimony 1
Testimony: I do not know anyone by the name of Knightley. We share no connection.
Person: Kanis
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I wouldn't think some motive for murder would just appear out of nowhere.
Person: Kanis
Testimony 3
Testimony: Or are you insinuating my Anubis had a motive?
Person: Kanis
Testimony 4
Testimony: Keh heh heh. He only bares his fangs at others on my command.
Person: Kanis

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other from the given lists. The user has provided a detailed set of characters, evidences, and testimonies, and I have to identify a pair where evidence and testimony directly contradict each other.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see what it states. Then, I'll check the corresponding evidence to see if there's a contradiction.

Starting with Testimony 0: Kanis claims he doesn't know Knightley and they share no connection. Looking at the evidence, Evidence 14 mentions that Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. This suggests a connection between them, which directly contradicts Kanis's testimony.

So, the evidence (Evidence 14) indicates a connection, while the testimony (Testimony 0) denies it. This seems to be a clear contradiction.

Before finalizing, I'll double-check if there are any other conflicting pairs. Testimony 1 also denies knowing Knightley, but it's similar to Testimony 0. Testimony 2 and 3 discuss Anubis, which isn't directly related to Knight. Testimony 4 talks about Anubis acting on command, which doesn't contradict any evidence provided.

Therefore, the most direct contradiction is between Evidence 14 and Testimony 0.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. There's a lot of information here, so I need to take it step by step.

First, let me look at the testimonies. Testimony 0 says, "I shared my reasoning with you the day before." Person: Gavèlle. So Gavèlle is talking about sharing reasoning the day before the body was found. Then Testimony 1 says, "Since Mr. Elbird did not see the body when he passed through the tunnel..." Person: Gavèlle. So Gavèlle is explaining that Elbird didn't see the body through the tunnel, implying maybe the body was moved or hidden somehow.

Testimony 2: "It could only have been dropped down the well during the show." Person: Gavèlle. So Gavèlle is suggesting that the body was dropped down a well during a show, which might involve someone like Saint's trick.

Testimony 3: "The only one who could have performed such an act is the suspect." Person: Gavèlle. So Gavèlle is pointing the finger at the suspect, which is Saint.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 23 is about Mr. Saint's Trick. It describes a contraption with a well, heavy weights, pulleys, and ropes used to send Saint flying during a show. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone. So this suggests that the body was found in the well after the show.

But in Testimony 2, Gavèlle says the body could only have been dropped down the well during the show. That aligns with Evidence 23. However, Testimony 3 says the only one who could have done that is the suspect, Saint. But Evidence 23 doesn't mention Saint; it just says someone replaced the weights with the body. So there's a contradiction here. Gavèlle is implying Saint did it, but the evidence doesn't directly link Saint to the well.

So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 23. Testimony 3 suggests Saint is the culprit, but the evidence doesn't support that directly. Instead, it just says someone replaced the weights with the body, which could be anyone, not necessarily Saint.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm presented with a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies from a murder case. My task is to identify which piece of evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to find only one pair where the evidence and testimony directly oppose each other.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see what it says. Then, I'll check the evidence to see if any of them provide information that contradicts the testimony.

Looking at Testimony 0: Laguarde says, "I believe that the culprit in this case could only have been Kanis." So, Laguarde is pointing towards Kanis as the murderer.

Now, I'll check the evidence related to Kanis. Evidence 21 mentions a chisel with traces of blood, hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Evidence 22 talks about two bells, one attached to Kanis's knife. Evidence 14 discusses a chess diagram showing a connection between Knight and Kanis through their correspondence chess.

But the critical point is that Evidence 21 and 22 connect Kanis to the murder weapon (chisel) and his dog, suggesting he might have used the chisel to kill Knight. However, Testimony 0 directly accuses Kanis of the murder, which aligns with the evidence pointing to him as the perpetrator.

Wait, but there's a contradiction here. If Kanis is the murderer, why is he being accused? But the evidence supports that he had the means and opportunity. However, the user is asking for a contradiction, so perhaps the testimony and evidence don't align in another way.

Wait, maybe I misread something. Let me check again.

Testimony 0 says Laguarde believes Kanis is the culprit. Evidence 21 and 22 connect Kanis to the chisel and his dog, which could be used to dispose of the body. But the user wants a contradiction, so perhaps the evidence contradicts the testimony in another aspect.

Wait, maybe the testimony suggests Kanis is the murderer, but the evidence shows that someone else is. But from the evidence, Kanis seems to be involved. Alternatively, maybe the testimony and evidence don't agree on the method of murder.

Wait, the user might be implying that the testimony suggests Kanis is the murderer, but the evidence shows that the rope was used to tie up the victim, not the chisel. But the evidence doesn't directly contradict the testimony; it supports it.

Wait, perhaps the contradiction is that the testimony suggests Kanis is the murderer, but the evidence shows that the chisel was used, which aligns with Kanis's method. So, maybe the user is pointing out that the testimony and evidence both support Kanis, but that's not a contradiction.

Alternatively, perhaps the testimony and evidence don't align in another way. Maybe the testimony says Kanis is the culprit, but the evidence shows that someone else is.

Wait, I'm getting confused. Let me re-examine the evidence and testimonies.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensors
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights that drop into the well were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I wouldn't go so far as to call it an interrogation.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 1
Testimony: Around 3 AM the day before the show, the victim was brought into my office.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 2
Testimony: I always make sure to talk to all the new arrivals.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mr. Knightley... Yes, we had a little chat.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 4
Testimony: After our talk, he went right back to his cell, I assure you.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 5
Testimony: Kanis was the one I hated. And he had no connection with the victim.
Person: Laguarde

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. So, I've been given a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder case. The goal is to find a pair where an evidence and a testimony contradict each other. The answer should be in JSON format, strictly ending with that line.

First, I need to understand the components involved:

1. **Characters**: There are 13 characters, each with a description. These include suspects, detectives, witnesses, etc.
2. **Evidences**: There are 24 pieces of evidence, each with a description that might relate to the murder.
3. **Testimonies**: There are 6 testimonies, each given by a character, providing their account of events.

The task is to find one evidence and one testimony that directly contradict each other. Contradiction here means that one piece of information negates or contradicts another.

I'll start by skimming through the testimonies to see what each one is saying. Then, I'll go through the evidence to see which ones could be in conflict with these testimonies.

**Testimony 0**: "I wouldn't go so far as to call it an interrogation."  
- Person: Laguarde

This seems to be about an interrogation not happening. So, any evidence that suggests an interrogation took place would contradict this testimony.

**Testimony 1**: "Around 3 AM the day before the show, the victim was brought into my office."  
- Person: Laguarde

This testimony mentions the victim being brought into the office at a specific time. If any evidence contradicts this timeline or the fact that the victim was in that office, that would be a contradiction.

**Testimony 2**: "I always make sure to talk to all the new arrivals."  
- Person: Laguarde

This suggests Laguarde interacts with new arrivals. If an evidence contradicts this, like showing that Laguarde didn't interact with a particular new arrival, that would be a contradiction.

**Testimony 3**: "Mr. Knightley... Yes, we had a little chat."  
- Person: Laguarde

This indicates a conversation between Laguarde and Knightley. If evidence shows they didn't have a conversation, that's a contradiction.

**Testimony 4**: "After our talk, he went right back to his cell, I assure you."  
- Person: Laguarde

This testimony supports the idea that Knightley returned to his cell after a conversation. If evidence shows he didn't return, or that he was elsewhere, that's a contradiction.

**Testimony 5**: "Kanis was the one I hated. And he had no connection with the victim."  
- Person: Laguarde

This testimony claims Kanis had no connection with the victim. If evidence shows they were connected, that's a contradiction.

Now, I'll look for evidence that could contradict these testimonies.

Starting with **Testimony 0**: "I wouldn't go so far as to call it an interrogation."  
- If there's evidence that an interrogation did take place, that would contradict this testimony. For example, if Evidence X shows that Laguarde conducted an interrogation, then that would be a contradiction.

Looking through the evidence list, I need to find any evidence that suggests an interrogation occurred. However, I don't immediately see an evidence that directly mentions an interrogation. So, maybe this testimony isn't the best pair.

Moving to **Testimony 1**: "Around 3 AM the day before the show, the victim was brought into my office."  
- If evidence contradicts the timing or the fact that the victim was in the office, that would work. For instance, if Evidence Y shows the victim was elsewhere at that time, or if there's no record of the victim being brought into the office, that would be a contradiction.

Looking at the evidence, **Evidence 17** mentions that the guard's keys, including Knight's cell key, were stolen the day before the murder. If Knight's cell key was stolen, it suggests he wasn't in his cell that night. However, Testimony 1 says the victim was brought into Laguarde's office at 3 AM, which is around the time the guard was attacked.

If the victim was in Laguarde's office at 3 AM, but the guard was attacked around that time, that might not directly contradict. But if the victim was in the office, and the guard was attacked elsewhere, that could be a point of contradiction.

Alternatively, if **Evidence 15** (Security Camera Footage) shows the victim being attacked at 9 AM, but Testimony 1 says he was brought in at 3 AM, that would be a contradiction because it implies he was already dead by 9 AM.

But the time stamps on the footage are off by three hours, so it was actually recorded around 9 AM but shows a 3 AM event. This discrepancy might not directly contradict Testimony 1, as both refer to around the same time.

Perhaps a better pair is **Testimony 5**: "Kanis was the one I hated. And he had no connection with the victim."  
- If evidence shows that Kanis had a connection with the victim, that would directly contradict this testimony.

Looking at the evidence, **Evidence 14** mentions that Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. This suggests a connection between them. Therefore, Testimony 5, which claims no connection, contradicts Evidence 14.

So, the pair would be Evidence 14 and Testimony 5.
</think>
